intro: Boesenbergia quangngaiensis, commonly known as the Quang Ngai ginger, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Vietnam. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes gingers and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, sword-shaped leaves and clusters of fragrant, yellowish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
